H0.text: What is the name of the opiate-like substances produced in the brain by pituitary glands. Neurokin

H1.text: What is the name of the opiate-like substances produced in the brain by pituitary glands. Pituiton

H2.text: What is the name of the opiate-like substances produced in the brain by pituitary glands. Cerebrin

H3.text: What is the name of the opiate-like substances produced in the brain by pituitary glands. Endorfin

A4.text: Endorphins (contracted from endogenous morphine) are peptides produced in the brain that block the perception of pain and increase feelings of wellbeing.

A5.text: Endorphins are endogenous painkillers often produced in the brain and adrenal medulla during physical exercise or orgasm and inhibit pain, muscle cramps, and relieve stress.
